030package squidpony.squidmath;
031
032import java.io.Serializable;
033
034import static squidpony.squidmath.Noise.IntPointHash.*;
035
036/**
037 * A wide range of noise functions that can all be called from one configurable object. Originally from Jordan Peck's
038 * FastNoise library, hence the name (these functions are sometimes, but not always, very fast for noise that doesn't
039 * use the GPU). This implements Noise2D, Noise3D, Noise4D, and Noise6D, and this is the fastest continuous noise
040 * algorithm in the library. Though it doesn't implement an interface for them, you can also use this to get
041 * ridged-multi simplex noise (the same type as {@link Noise.Ridged2D}) with {@link #ridged2D(float, float, int, int)},
042 * {@link #ridged3D(float, float, float, int, int)}, or any of the overloads that allow specifying alternate lacunarity
043 * and gain.
044 */
045public class FastNoise implements Serializable, Noise.Noise2D, Noise.Noise3D, Noise.Noise4D, Noise.Noise6D {

394    private static final long serialVersionUID = 2L;
395    public static final int VALUE = 0, VALUE_FRACTAL = 1, PERLIN = 2, PERLIN_FRACTAL = 3,
396            SIMPLEX = 4, SIMPLEX_FRACTAL = 5, CELLULAR = 6, WHITE_NOISE = 7, CUBIC = 8, CUBIC_FRACTAL = 9;
397
398    public static final int LINEAR = 0, HERMITE = 1, QUINTIC = 2;
399
400    public static final int FBM = 0, BILLOW = 1, RIDGED_MULTI = 2;
401
402    public static final int EUCLIDEAN = 0, MANHATTAN = 1, NATURAL = 2;
403
404    public static final int CELL_VALUE = 0, NOISE_LOOKUP = 1, DISTANCE = 2, DISTANCE_2 = 3,
405            DISTANCE_2_ADD = 4, DISTANCE_2_SUB = 5, DISTANCE_2_MUL = 6, DISTANCE_2_DIV = 7;

407    private int seed = 1337;
408    private float frequency = 0.03125f;
409    private int interpolation = HERMITE;
410    private int noiseType = SIMPLEX_FRACTAL;
411
412    private int octaves = 1;
413    private float lacunarity = 2f;
414    private float gain = 0.5f;
415    private int fractalType = FBM;
416
417    private float fractalBounding;
418
419    private int cellularDistanceFunction = EUCLIDEAN;
420    private int cellularReturnType = CELL_VALUE;
421    private FastNoise cellularNoiseLookup = null;

423    private float gradientPerturbAmp = 1f / 0.45f;

425    /**
426     * A publicly available FastNoise object with seed 1337, frequency 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise using
427     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType, 2f lacunarity and 0.5f gain. It's encouraged to use methods that temporarily configure
428     * this variable, like {@link #getNoiseWithSeed(float, float, int)} rather than changing its settings and using a
429     * method that needs that lasting configuration, like {@link #getConfiguredNoise(float, float)}.
430     */
431    public static final FastNoise instance = new FastNoise();
432    /**
433     * A constructor that takes no parameters, and uses all default settings with a seed of 1337. An example call to
434     * this would be {@code new FastNoise()}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1
435     * octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
436     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
437     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
438     */
439    public FastNoise() {
440        this(1337);
441    }
442
443    /**
444     * A constructor that takes only a parameter for the FastNoise's seed, which should produce different results for
445     * any different seeds. An example call to this would be {@code new FastNoise(1337)}, which makes noise with the
446     * seed 1337, a default frequency of 1.0f/32.0f, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count,
447     * it always uses 1 even for the SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call
448     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain
449     * (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
450     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
451     */
452    public FastNoise(int seed) {
453        this.seed = seed;
454        calculateFractalBounding();
455    }
456    /**
457     * A constructor that takes two parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
458     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
459     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for the 
460     * SIMPLEX_FRACTAL noiseType this uses, but you can call {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later to benefit from the
461     * fractal noiseType), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
462     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
463     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
464     */
465    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency)
466    {
467        this(seed, frequency, SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
468    }
469    /**
470     * A constructor that takes a few parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
471     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
472     * frequency, 1 octave of Simplex noise (since this doesn't specify octave count, it always uses 1 even for 
473     * noiseTypes like SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, but using a fractal noiseType can make sense if you call
474     * {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)} later), and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
475     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
476     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
477     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
478     */
479    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType)
480    {
481        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, 1, 2f, 0.5f);
482    }
483
484    /**
485     * A constructor that takes several parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
486     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4)}, which makes noise with the seed 1337, a lower
487     * frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and normal lacunarity and gain (when unspecified, they are 2f and 0.5f).
488     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
489     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
490     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
491     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
492     */
493    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves)
494    {
495        this(seed, frequency, noiseType, octaves, 2f, 0.5f);
496    }
497
498    /**
499     * A constructor that takes a lot of parameters to specify the FastNoise from the start. An example call to this
500     * would be {@code new FastNoise(1337, 0.02f, FastNoise.SIMPLEX_FRACTAL, 4, 0.5f, 2f)}, which makes noise with a
501     * lower frequency, 4 octaves of Simplex noise, and the "inverse" effect on how those octaves work (which makes
502     * the extra added octaves be more significant to the final result and also have a lower frequency, while normally
503     * added octaves have a higher frequency and tend to have a minor effect on the large-scale shape of the noise).
504     * @param seed the int seed for the noise, which should significantly affect the produced noise
505     * @param frequency the multiplier for all dimensions, which is usually fairly small (1.0f/32.0f is the default)
506     * @param noiseType the noiseType, which should be a constant from this class (see {@link #setNoiseType(int)})
507     * @param octaves how many octaves of noise to use when the noiseType is one of the _FRACTAL types
508     * @param lacunarity typically 2.0, or 0.5 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode) 
509     * @param gain typically 0.5, or 2.0 to change how extra octaves work (inverse mode)
510     */
511    public FastNoise(int seed, float frequency, int noiseType, int octaves, float lacunarity, float gain)
512    {
513        this.seed = seed;
514        this.frequency = frequency;
515        this.noiseType = noiseType;
516        this.octaves = octaves;
517        this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
518        this.gain = gain;
519        calculateFractalBounding();
520    }
521
522    protected static float dotf(final float[] g, final float x, final float y) {
523        return g[0] * x + g[1] * y;
524    }
525
526    /**
527     * @return Returns the seed used by this object
528     */
529    public int getSeed() {
530        return seed;
531    }
532

534    // Default: 1337L

536    /**
537     * Sets the seed used for all noise types, as a long.
538     * If this is not called, defaults to 1337L.
539     * @param seed a seed as a long
540     */
541    public void setSeed(int seed) {
542        this.seed = seed;
543    }

545    /**
546     * Sets the frequency for all noise types. If this is not called, it defaults to 0.03125f (or 1f/32f).
547     * @param frequency the frequency for all noise types, as a positive non-zero float
548     */
549    public void setFrequency(float frequency) {
550        this.frequency = frequency;
551    }
552
553    /**
554     * Gets the frequency for all noise types. The default is 0.03125f, or 1f/32f.
555     * @return the frequency for all noise types, which should be a positive non-zero float
556     */
557    public float getFrequency()
558    {
559        return frequency;
560    }
561
562    /**
563     * Changes the interpolation method used to smooth between noise values, using on of the following constants from
564     * this class (lowest to highest quality): {@link #LINEAR} (0), {@link #HERMITE} (1), or {@link #QUINTIC} (2). If
565     * this is not called, it defaults to HERMITE. This is used in Value, Gradient Noise and Position Perturbing.
566     * @param interpolation an int (0, 1, or 2) corresponding  to a constant from this class for an interpolation level
567     */
568    public void setInterpolation(int interpolation) {
569        this.interpolation = interpolation;
570    }
571
572    /**
573     * Sets the default type of noise returned by {@link #getConfiguredNoise(float, float)}, using one of the following constants
574     * in this class:
575     * {@link #VALUE} (0), {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL} (1), {@link #PERLIN} (2), {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL} (3),
576     * {@link #SIMPLEX} (4), {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} (5), {@link #CELLULAR} (6), {@link #WHITE_NOISE} (7),
577     * {@link #CUBIC} (8), or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} (9). If this isn't called, getConfiguredNoise() will default to SIMPLEX.
578     * @param noiseType an int from 0 to 9 corresponding to a constant from this class for a noise type
579     */
580    public void setNoiseType(int noiseType) {
581        this.noiseType = noiseType;
582    }
583
584    /**
585     * Gets the default type of noise returned by {@link #getConfiguredNoise(float, float)}, using one of the following constants
586     * in this class:
587     * {@link #VALUE} (0), {@link #VALUE_FRACTAL} (1), {@link #PERLIN} (2), {@link #PERLIN_FRACTAL} (3),
588     * {@link #SIMPLEX} (4), {@link #SIMPLEX_FRACTAL} (5), {@link #CELLULAR} (6), {@link #WHITE_NOISE} (7),
589     * {@link #CUBIC} (8), or {@link #CUBIC_FRACTAL} (9). The default is SIMPLEX.
590     * @return the noise type as a code, from 0 to 9 inclusive
591     */
592    public int getNoiseType()
593    {
594        return noiseType;
595    }
596
597    /**
598     * Sets the octave count for all fractal noise types.
599     * If this isn't called, it will default to 3.
600     * @param octaves the number of octaves to use for fractal noise types, as a positive non-zero int
601     */
602    public void setFractalOctaves(int octaves) {
603        this.octaves = octaves;
604        calculateFractalBounding();
605    }
606
607    /**
608     * Gets the octave count for all fractal noise types. The default is 3.
609     * @return the number of octaves to use for fractal noise types, as a positive non-zero int
610     */
611    public int getFractalOctaves()
612    {
613        return octaves;
614    }
615
616    /**
617     * Sets the octave lacunarity for all fractal noise types.
618     * Lacunarity is a multiplicative change to frequency between octaves. If this isn't called, it defaults to 2.
619     * @param lacunarity a non-0 float that will be used for the lacunarity of fractal noise types; commonly 2.0 or 0.5
620     */
621    public void setFractalLacunarity(float lacunarity) {
622        this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
623    }
624
625    /**
626     * Sets the octave gain for all fractal noise types.
627     * If this isn't called, it defaults to 0.5.
628     * @param gain the gain between octaves, as a float
629     */
630    public void setFractalGain(float gain) {
631        this.gain = gain;
632        calculateFractalBounding();
633    }
634
635    /**
636     * Sets the method for combining octaves in all fractal noise types, allowing an int argument corresponding to one
637     * of the following constants from this class: {@link #FBM} (0), {@link #BILLOW} (1), or {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} (2).
638     * If this hasn't been called, it will use FBM.
639     * @param fractalType an int (0, 1, or 2) that corresponds to a constant like {@link #FBM} or {@link #RIDGED_MULTI}
640     */
641    public void setFractalType(int fractalType) {
642        this.fractalType = fractalType;
643    }
644
645    /**
646     * Gets the method for combining octaves in all fractal noise types, allowing an int argument corresponding to one
647     * of the following constants from this class: {@link #FBM} (0), {@link #BILLOW} (1), or {@link #RIDGED_MULTI} (2).
648     * The default is FBM.     
649     * @return the fractal type as a code; 0, 1, or 2
650     */
651    public int getFractalType()
652    {
653        return fractalType;
654    }
655    /**
656     * Sets the distance function used in cellular noise calculations, allowing an int argument corresponding to one of
657     * the following constants from this class: {@link #EUCLIDEAN} (0), {@link #MANHATTAN} (1), or {@link #NATURAL} (2).
658     * If this hasn't been called, it will use EUCLIDEAN.
659     * @param cellularDistanceFunction an int that can be 0, 1, or 2, corresponding to a constant from this class
660     */
661    public void setCellularDistanceFunction(int cellularDistanceFunction) {
662        this.cellularDistanceFunction = cellularDistanceFunction;
663    }
664    // Sets
665    // Note: NoiseLookup requires another FastNoise object be set with setCellularNoiseLookup() to function
666    // Default: CellValue
667
668    /**
669     * Sets the return type from cellular noise calculations, allowing an int argument corresponding to one of the
670     * following constants from this class: {@link #CELL_VALUE} (0), {@link #NOISE_LOOKUP} (1), {@link #DISTANCE} (2),
671     * {@link #DISTANCE_2} (3), {@link #DISTANCE_2_ADD} (4), {@link #DISTANCE_2_SUB} (5), {@link #DISTANCE_2_MUL} (6),
672     * or {@link #DISTANCE_2_DIV} (7). If this isn't called, it will use CELL_VALUE.
673     * @param cellularReturnType
674     */
675    public void setCellularReturnType(int cellularReturnType) {
676        this.cellularReturnType = cellularReturnType;
677    }
678
679    // FastNoise used to calculate a cell value if cellular return type is NoiseLookup
680    // The lookup value is acquired through getConfiguredNoise() so ensure you setNoiseType() on the noise lookup, value, gradient or simplex is recommended
681    public void setCellularNoiseLookup(FastNoise noise) {
682        cellularNoiseLookup = noise;
683    }
684
685    // Sets the maximum perturb distance from original location when using gradientPerturb{Fractal}(...)
686    // Default: 1.0
687    public void setGradientPerturbAmp(float gradientPerturbAmp) {
688        this.gradientPerturbAmp = gradientPerturbAmp / (float) 0.45;
689    }
690
691    public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
692        return getConfiguredNoise((float)x, (float)y);
693    }
694
695    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
696        int s = this.seed;
697        this.seed = (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32);
698        double r = getConfiguredNoise((float)x, (float)y);
699        this.seed = s;
700        return r;
701    }
702
703    public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
704        return getConfiguredNoise((float)x, (float)y, (float)z);
705    }
706
707    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
708        int s = this.seed;
709        this.seed = (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32);
710        double r = getConfiguredNoise((float)x, (float)y, (float)z);
711        this.seed = s;
712        return r;
713    }

715    public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
716        return getConfiguredNoise((float)x, (float)y, (float)z, (float)w);
717    }

719    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
720        int s = this.seed;
721        this.seed = (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32);
722        double r = getConfiguredNoise((float)x, (float)y, (float)z, (float)w);
723        this.seed = s;
724        return r;
725    }

729    }

731    public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
732        int s = this.seed;
733        this.seed = (int) (seed ^ seed >>> 32);
734        double r = getConfiguredNoise((float)x, (float)y, (float)z, (float)w, (float)u, (float)v);
735        this.seed = s;
736        return r;

740    public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, float y, int seed) {
741        final int s = this.seed;
742        this.seed = seed;
743        float r = getConfiguredNoise(x, y);
744        this.seed = s;
745        return r;
746    }
747    public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, float y, float z, int seed) {
748        final int s = this.seed;
749        this.seed = seed;
750        float r = getConfiguredNoise(x, y, z);
751        this.seed = s;
752        return r;
753    }
754    public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, float y, float z, float w, int seed) {
755        final int s = this.seed;
756        this.seed = seed;
757        float r = getConfiguredNoise(x, y, z, w);
758        this.seed = s;
759        return r;
760    }
761
762    public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v, int seed) {
763        final int s = this.seed;
764        this.seed = seed;
765        float r = getConfiguredNoise(x, y, z, w, u, v);
766        this.seed = s;
767        return r;
768    }
769
770    // takes slightly less storage than an array of float[2]
771    private static class Float2 {
772        public final float x, y;
773
774        Float2(float x, float y) {
775            this.x = x;
776            this.y = y;
777        }
778    }
779
780    // takes slightly less storage than an array of float[3]
781    private static class Float3 {
782        public final float x, y, z;
783
784        Float3(float x, float y, float z) {
785            this.x = x;
786            this.y = y;
787            this.z = z;
788        }
789    }

899
900
901    private static int fastFloor(float f) {
902        return (f >= 0 ? (int) f : (int) f - 1);
903    }
904
905
906    private static int fastRound(float f) {
907        return (f >= 0) ? (int) (f + 0.5f) : (int) (f - 0.5f);
908    }
909
910
911    private static float lerp(float a, float b, float t) {
912        return a + t * (b - a);
913    }
914
915
916    private static float hermiteInterpolator(float t) {
917        return t * t * (3 - 2 * t);
918    }
919
920
921    private static float quinticInterpolator(float t) {
922        return t * t * t * (t * (t * 6 - 15) + 10);
923    }
924
925
926    private static float cubicLerp(float a, float b, float c, float d, float t) {
927        float p = (d - c) - (a - b);
928        return t * (t * t * p + t * ((a - b) - p) + (c - a)) + b;
929    }
930
931    private void calculateFractalBounding() {
932        float amp = gain;
933        float ampFractal = 1;
934        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
935            ampFractal += amp;
936            amp *= gain;
937        }
938        fractalBounding = 1 / ampFractal;
939    }
940
941    private static float valCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y) {
942        return (hashAll(x, y, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
943    }
944
945    private static float valCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z) {
946        return (hashAll(x, y, z, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
947    }
948
949    private static float valCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w) {
950        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
951    }
952
953    private static float valCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v) {
954        return (hashAll(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed) >> 7) * 0x1.0p-24f;
955    }
956
957    protected static float gradCoord2D(int seed, int x, int y, float xd, float yd) {
958        final float[] g = phiGrad2f[hash256(x, y, seed)];
959        return xd * g[0] + yd * g[1];
960    }
961
962    protected static float gradCoord3D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, float xd, float yd, float zd) {
963        final Float3 g = GRAD_3D[hash32(x, y, z, seed)];
964        return xd * g.x + yd * g.y + zd * g.z;
965    }
966
967    protected static float gradCoord4D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd) {
968        final int hash = hash256(x, y, z, w, seed) & 0xFC;
969        return xd * grad4f[hash] + yd * grad4f[hash + 1] + zd * grad4f[hash + 2] + wd * grad4f[hash + 3];
970    }
971
972    protected static float gradCoord6D(int seed, int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v,
973                                       float xd, float yd, float zd, float wd, float ud, float vd) {
974        final int hash = hash256(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed) * 6;
975        return xd * grad6f[hash] + yd * grad6f[hash + 1] + zd * grad6f[hash + 2]
976                + wd * grad6f[hash + 3] + ud * grad6f[hash + 4] + vd * grad6f[hash + 5];
977    }
978    /**
979     * After being configured with the setters in this class, such as {@link #setNoiseType(int)},
980     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
981     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 3D.
982     * @param x
983     * @param y
984     * @param z
985     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
986     */
987    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y, float z) {
988        x *= frequency;
989        y *= frequency;
990        z *= frequency;
991
992        switch (noiseType) {
993            case VALUE:
994                return singleValue(seed, x, y, z);
995            case VALUE_FRACTAL:
996                switch (fractalType) {
997                    case BILLOW:
998                        return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z);
999                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1000                        return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1001                    default:
1002                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1003                }
1004            case PERLIN:
1005                return singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z);
1006            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
1007                switch (fractalType) {
1008                    case BILLOW:
1009                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1010                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1011                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1012                    default:
1013                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1014                }
1015            case SIMPLEX_FRACTAL:
1016                switch (fractalType) {
1017                    case BILLOW:
1018                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1019                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1020                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1021                    default:
1022                        return singleSimplexFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1023                }
1024            case CELLULAR:
1025                switch (cellularReturnType) {
1026                    case CELL_VALUE:
1027                    case NOISE_LOOKUP:
1028                    case DISTANCE:
1029                        return singleCellular(x, y, z);
1030                    default:
1031                        return singleCellular2Edge(x, y, z);
1032                }
1033            case WHITE_NOISE:
1034                return getWhiteNoise(x, y, z);
1035            case CUBIC:
1036                return singleCubic(seed, x, y, z);
1037            case CUBIC_FRACTAL:
1038                switch (fractalType) {
1039                    case BILLOW:
1040                        return singleCubicFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1041                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1042                        return singleCubicFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1043                    default:
1044                        return singleCubicFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1045                }
1046            default:
1047                return singleSimplex(seed, x, y, z);
1048        }
1049    }
1050
1051    /**
1052     * After being configured with the setters in this class, such as {@link #setNoiseType(int)},
1053     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
1054     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 2D.
1055     * @param x
1056     * @param y
1057     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
1058     */
1059    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y) {
1060        x *= frequency;
1061        y *= frequency;
1062
1063        switch (noiseType) {
1064            case VALUE:

1066            case VALUE_FRACTAL:
1067                switch (fractalType) {

1070                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1071                        return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1072                    default:
1073                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
1074                }

1077            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
1078                switch (fractalType) {
1079                    case BILLOW:
1080                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y);
1081                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1082                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1083                    default:
1084                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y);
1085                }
1086            case SIMPLEX_FRACTAL:

1088                    case BILLOW:
1089                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y);
1090                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1091                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1092                    default:

1094                }
1095            case CELLULAR:

1097                    case CELL_VALUE:
1098                    case NOISE_LOOKUP:
1099                    case DISTANCE:
1100                        return singleCellular(x, y);
1101                    default:

1103                }
1104            case WHITE_NOISE:

1106            case CUBIC:

1108            case CUBIC_FRACTAL:

1110                    case BILLOW:
1111                        return singleCubicFractalBillow(x, y);
1112                    case RIDGED_MULTI:

1114                    default:
1115                        return singleCubicFractalFBM(x, y);
1116                }
1117            default:
1118                return singleSimplex(seed, x, y);
1119        }
1120    }

1187     * {@link #setFrequency(float)}, {@link #setFractalOctaves(int)}, and {@link #setFractalType(int)}, among others,
1188     * you can call this method to get the particular variety of noise you specified, in 3D.

1190     * @param y
1191     * @param z
1192     * @param w

1194     * @param v
1195     * @return noise as a float from -1f to 1f
1196     */
1197    public float getConfiguredNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1198        x *= frequency;
1199        y *= frequency;
1200        z *= frequency;
1201        w *= frequency;
1202        u *= frequency;
1203        v *= frequency;
1204
1205        switch (noiseType) {
1206            case VALUE:
1207                return singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v);
1208            case VALUE_FRACTAL:
1209                switch (fractalType) {
1210                    case BILLOW:
1211                        return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1212                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1213                        return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1214                    default:
1215                        return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1216                }
1217            case WHITE_NOISE:
1218                return getWhiteNoise(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1219            case PERLIN:
1220                return singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v);
1221            case PERLIN_FRACTAL:
1222                switch (fractalType) {
1223                    case BILLOW:
1224                        return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1225                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1226                        return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1227                    default:
1228                        return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1229                }
1230            case SIMPLEX_FRACTAL:
1231                switch (fractalType) {
1232                    case BILLOW:
1233                        return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1234                    case RIDGED_MULTI:
1235                        return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1236                    default:
1237                        return singleSimplexFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u, v);

1241        }
1242    }

1244    // White Noise
1245
1246    private int floatToIntMixed(final float f) {
1247        final int i = Float.floatToIntBits(f);
1248        return i ^ i >>> 16;
1249    }
1250
1251    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1252        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1253        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1254        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1255        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1256        int ui = floatToIntMixed(u);
1257        int vi = floatToIntMixed(v);
1258
1259        return valCoord6D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi, ui, vi);
1260    }
1261
1262    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1263        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1264        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1265        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1266        int wi = floatToIntMixed(w);
1267
1268        return valCoord4D(seed, xi, yi, zi, wi);
1269    }
1270
1271    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y, float z) {
1272        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1273        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1274        int zi = floatToIntMixed(z);
1275
1276        return valCoord3D(seed, xi, yi, zi);
1277    }
1278
1279    public float getWhiteNoise(float x, float y) {
1280        int xi = floatToIntMixed(x);
1281        int yi = floatToIntMixed(y);
1282
1283        return valCoord2D(seed, xi, yi);
1284    }
1285
1286    public float getWhiteNoiseInt(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v) {
1287        return valCoord6D(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v);
1288    }
1289
1290    public float getWhiteNoiseInt(int x, int y, int z, int w) {
1291        return valCoord4D(seed, x, y, z, w);
1292    }
1293
1294    public float getWhiteNoiseInt(int x, int y, int z) {
1295        return valCoord3D(seed, x, y, z);
1296    }
1297
1298    public float getWhiteNoiseInt(int x, int y) {
1299        return valCoord2D(seed, x, y);
1300    }
1301
1302    // Value Noise
1303    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z) {
1304        x *= frequency;
1305        y *= frequency;
1306        z *= frequency;
1307
1308        switch (fractalType) {
1309            case BILLOW:
1310                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1311            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1312                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1313            default:
1314                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1315        }
1316    }
1317
1318    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z) {
1319        int seed = this.seed;
1320        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z);
1321        float amp = 1;
1322
1323        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1324            x *= lacunarity;
1325            y *= lacunarity;
1326            z *= lacunarity;
1327
1328            amp *= gain;
1329            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z) * amp;
1330        }
1331
1332        return sum * fractalBounding;
1333    }
1334
1335    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z) {
1336        int seed = this.seed;
1337        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1;
1338        float amp = 1;
1339
1340        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1341            x *= lacunarity;
1342            y *= lacunarity;
1343            z *= lacunarity;
1344
1345            amp *= gain;
1346            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1347        }
1348
1349        return sum * fractalBounding;
1350    }
1351
1352    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z) {
1353        int seed = this.seed;
1354        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1355        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1356            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z));
1357            spike *= spike * amp;
1358            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1359            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1360            ampBias *= 2f;
1361            x *= lacunarity;
1362            y *= lacunarity;
1363            z *= lacunarity;
1364        }
1365        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1366    }
1367
1368    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z) {
1369        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency);
1370    }
1371
1372    private float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z) {
1373        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
1374        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
1375        int z0 = fastFloor(z);
1376        int x1 = x0 + 1;
1377        int y1 = y0 + 1;
1378        int z1 = z0 + 1;
1379
1380        float xs, ys, zs;
1381        switch (interpolation) {
1382            default:
1383            case LINEAR:
1384                xs = x - x0;
1385                ys = y - y0;
1386                zs = z - z0;
1387                break;
1388            case HERMITE:
1389                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
1390                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
1391                zs = hermiteInterpolator(z - z0);
1392                break;
1393            case QUINTIC:
1394                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
1395                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
1396                zs = quinticInterpolator(z - z0);
1397                break;
1398        }
1399
1400        float xf00 = lerp(valCoord3D(seed, x0, y0, z0), valCoord3D(seed, x1, y0, z0), xs);
1401        float xf10 = lerp(valCoord3D(seed, x0, y1, z0), valCoord3D(seed, x1, y1, z0), xs);
1402        float xf01 = lerp(valCoord3D(seed, x0, y0, z1), valCoord3D(seed, x1, y0, z1), xs);
1403        float xf11 = lerp(valCoord3D(seed, x0, y1, z1), valCoord3D(seed, x1, y1, z1), xs);
1404
1405        float yf0 = lerp(xf00, xf10, ys);
1406        float yf1 = lerp(xf01, xf11, ys);
1407
1408        return lerp(yf0, yf1, zs);
1409    }
1410
1411    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1412        x *= frequency;
1413        y *= frequency;
1414        z *= frequency;
1415        w *= frequency;
1416
1417        switch (fractalType) {
1418            case BILLOW:
1419                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w);
1420            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1421                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w);
1422            default:
1423                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w);
1424        }
1425    }
1426
1427
1428    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1429        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency);
1430    }
1431
1432    private float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1433        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
1434        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
1435        int z0 = fastFloor(z);
1436        int w0 = fastFloor(w);
1437        int x1 = x0 + 1;
1438        int y1 = y0 + 1;
1439        int z1 = z0 + 1;
1440        int w1 = w0 + 1;
1441
1442        float xs, ys, zs, ws;
1443        switch (interpolation) {
1444            default:
1445            case LINEAR:
1446                xs = x - x0;
1447                ys = y - y0;
1448                zs = z - z0;
1449                ws = w - w0;
1450                break;
1451            case HERMITE:
1452                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
1453                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
1454                zs = hermiteInterpolator(z - z0);
1455                ws = hermiteInterpolator(w - w0);
1456                break;
1457            case QUINTIC:
1458                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
1459                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
1460                zs = quinticInterpolator(z - z0);
1461                ws = quinticInterpolator(w - w0);
1462                break;
1463        }
1464
1465        final float xf000 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w0), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w0), xs);
1466        final float xf100 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w0), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w0), xs);
1467        final float xf010 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w0), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w0), xs);
1468        final float xf110 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w0), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w0), xs);
1469        final float xf001 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w1), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w1), xs);
1470        final float xf101 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w1), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w1), xs);
1471        final float xf011 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w1), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w1), xs);
1472        final float xf111 = lerp(valCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w1), valCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w1), xs);
1473
1474        final float yf00 = lerp(xf000, xf100, ys);
1475        final float yf10 = lerp(xf010, xf110, ys);
1476        final float yf01 = lerp(xf001, xf101, ys);
1477        final float yf11 = lerp(xf011, xf111, ys);
1478
1479        final float zf0 = lerp(yf00, yf10, zs);
1480        final float zf1 = lerp(yf01, yf11, zs);
1481        return lerp(zf0, zf1, ws);
1482    }
1483    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1484        int seed = this.seed;
1485        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w);
1486        float amp = 1;
1487
1488        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1489            x *= lacunarity;
1490            y *= lacunarity;
1491            z *= lacunarity;
1492            w *= lacunarity;
1493
1494            amp *= gain;
1495            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w) * amp;
1496        }
1497
1498        return sum * fractalBounding;
1499    }
1500
1501    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1502        int seed = this.seed;
1503        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w)) * 2 - 1;
1504        float amp = 1;
1505
1506        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1507            x *= lacunarity;
1508            y *= lacunarity;
1509            z *= lacunarity;
1510            w *= lacunarity;
1511
1512            amp *= gain;
1513            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1514        }
1515
1516        return sum * fractalBounding;
1517    }
1518
1519    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1520        int seed = this.seed;
1521        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1522        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1523            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z, w));
1524            spike *= spike * amp;
1525            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1526            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1527            ampBias *= 2f;
1528            x *= lacunarity;
1529            y *= lacunarity;
1530            z *= lacunarity;
1531            w *= lacunarity;
1532        }
1533        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1534    }
1535
1536    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y) {
1537        x *= frequency;
1538        y *= frequency;
1539
1540        switch (fractalType) {
1541            case FBM:
1542                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y);
1543            case BILLOW:
1544                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y);
1545            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1546                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
1547            default:
1548                return 0;
1549        }
1550    }
1551
1552    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
1553        int seed = this.seed;
1554        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y);
1555        float amp = 1;
1556
1557        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1558            x *= lacunarity;
1559            y *= lacunarity;
1560
1561            amp *= gain;
1562            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y) * amp;
1563        }
1564
1565        return sum * fractalBounding;
1566    }
1567
1568    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
1569        int seed = this.seed;
1570        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
1571        float amp = 1;
1572
1573        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1574            x *= lacunarity;
1575            y *= lacunarity;
1576            amp *= gain;
1577            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1578        }
1579
1580        return sum * fractalBounding;
1581    }
1582
1583    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
1584        int seed = this.seed;
1585        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1586        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1587            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y));
1588            spike *= spike * amp;
1589            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1590            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1591            ampBias *= 2f;
1592            x *= lacunarity;
1593            y *= lacunarity;
1594        }
1595        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1596    }
1597
1598    public float getValue(float x, float y) {
1599        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
1600    }
1601
1602    private float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y) {
1603        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
1604        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
1605        int x1 = x0 + 1;
1606        int y1 = y0 + 1;
1607
1608        float xs, ys;
1609        switch (interpolation) {
1610            default:
1611            case LINEAR:
1612                xs = x - x0;
1613                ys = y - y0;
1614                break;
1615            case HERMITE:
1616                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
1617                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
1618                break;
1619            case QUINTIC:
1620                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
1621                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
1622                break;
1623        }
1624
1625        float xf0 = lerp(valCoord2D(seed, x0, y0), valCoord2D(seed, x1, y0), xs);
1626        float xf1 = lerp(valCoord2D(seed, x0, y1), valCoord2D(seed, x1, y1), xs);
1627
1628        return lerp(xf0, xf1, ys);
1629    }
1630
1631    public float getValueFractal(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1632        x *= frequency;
1633        y *= frequency;
1634        z *= frequency;
1635        w *= frequency;
1636        u *= frequency;
1637        v *= frequency;
1638
1639        switch (fractalType) {
1640            case BILLOW:
1641                return singleValueFractalBillow(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1642            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1643                return singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1644            default:
1645                return singleValueFractalFBM(x, y, z, w, u, v);
1646        }
1647    }
1648
1649    public float getValue(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1650        return singleValue(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency, u * frequency, v * frequency);
1651    }
1652
1653    private float singleValue(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1654        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
1655        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
1656        int z0 = fastFloor(z);
1657        int w0 = fastFloor(w);
1658        int u0 = fastFloor(u);
1659        int v0 = fastFloor(v);
1660        int x1 = x0 + 1;
1661        int y1 = y0 + 1;
1662        int z1 = z0 + 1;
1663        int w1 = w0 + 1;
1664        int u1 = u0 + 1;
1665        int v1 = v0 + 1;
1666
1667        float xs, ys, zs, ws, us, vs;
1668        switch (interpolation) {
1669            default:
1670            case LINEAR:
1671                xs = x - x0;
1672                ys = y - y0;
1673                zs = z - z0;
1674                ws = w - w0;
1675                us = u - u0;
1676                vs = v - v0;
1677                break;
1678            case HERMITE:
1679                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
1680                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
1681                zs = hermiteInterpolator(z - z0);
1682                ws = hermiteInterpolator(w - w0);
1683                us = hermiteInterpolator(u - u0);
1684                vs = hermiteInterpolator(v - v0);
1685                break;
1686            case QUINTIC:
1687                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
1688                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
1689                zs = quinticInterpolator(z - z0);
1690                ws = quinticInterpolator(w - w0);
1691                us = quinticInterpolator(u - u0);
1692                vs = quinticInterpolator(v - v0);
1693                break;
1694        }
1695
1696        final float xf00000 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w0, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w0, u0, v0), xs);
1697        final float xf10000 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w0, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w0, u0, v0), xs);
1698        final float xf01000 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w0, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w0, u0, v0), xs);
1699        final float xf11000 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w0, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w0, u0, v0), xs);
1700        final float xf00100 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w1, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w1, u0, v0), xs);
1701        final float xf10100 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w1, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w1, u0, v0), xs);
1702        final float xf01100 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w1, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w1, u0, v0), xs);
1703        final float xf11100 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w1, u0, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w1, u0, v0), xs);
1704
1705        final float xf00010 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w0, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w0, u1, v0), xs);
1706        final float xf10010 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w0, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w0, u1, v0), xs);
1707        final float xf01010 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w0, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w0, u1, v0), xs);
1708        final float xf11010 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w0, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w0, u1, v0), xs);
1709        final float xf00110 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w1, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w1, u1, v0), xs);
1710        final float xf10110 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w1, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w1, u1, v0), xs);
1711        final float xf01110 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w1, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w1, u1, v0), xs);
1712        final float xf11110 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w1, u1, v0), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w1, u1, v0), xs);
1713
1714        final float xf00001 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w0, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w0, u0, v1), xs);
1715        final float xf10001 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w0, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w0, u0, v1), xs);
1716        final float xf01001 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w0, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w0, u0, v1), xs);
1717        final float xf11001 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w0, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w0, u0, v1), xs);
1718        final float xf00101 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w1, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w1, u0, v1), xs);
1719        final float xf10101 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w1, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w1, u0, v1), xs);
1720        final float xf01101 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w1, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w1, u0, v1), xs);
1721        final float xf11101 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w1, u0, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w1, u0, v1), xs);
1722
1723        final float xf00011 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w0, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w0, u1, v1), xs);
1724        final float xf10011 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w0, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w0, u1, v1), xs);
1725        final float xf01011 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w0, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w0, u1, v1), xs);
1726        final float xf11011 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w0, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w0, u1, v1), xs);
1727        final float xf00111 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w1, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w1, u1, v1), xs);
1728        final float xf10111 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w1, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w1, u1, v1), xs);
1729        final float xf01111 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w1, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w1, u1, v1), xs);
1730        final float xf11111 = lerp(valCoord6D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w1, u1, v1), valCoord6D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w1, u1, v1), xs);
1731
1732        final float yf0000 = lerp(xf00000, xf10000, ys);
1733        final float yf1000 = lerp(xf01000, xf11000, ys);
1734        final float yf0100 = lerp(xf00100, xf10100, ys);
1735        final float yf1100 = lerp(xf01100, xf11100, ys);
1736
1737        final float yf0010 = lerp(xf00010, xf10010, ys);
1738        final float yf1010 = lerp(xf01010, xf11010, ys);
1739        final float yf0110 = lerp(xf00110, xf10110, ys);
1740        final float yf1110 = lerp(xf01110, xf11110, ys);
1741
1742        final float yf0001 = lerp(xf00001, xf10001, ys);
1743        final float yf1001 = lerp(xf01001, xf11001, ys);
1744        final float yf0101 = lerp(xf00101, xf10101, ys);
1745        final float yf1101 = lerp(xf01101, xf11101, ys);
1746
1747        final float yf0011 = lerp(xf00011, xf10011, ys);
1748        final float yf1011 = lerp(xf01011, xf11011, ys);
1749        final float yf0111 = lerp(xf00111, xf10111, ys);
1750        final float yf1111 = lerp(xf01111, xf11111, ys);
1751
1752        final float zf000 = lerp(yf0000, yf1000, zs);
1753        final float zf100 = lerp(yf0100, yf1100, zs);
1754
1755        final float zf010 = lerp(yf0010, yf1010, zs);
1756        final float zf110 = lerp(yf0110, yf1110, zs);
1757
1758        final float zf001 = lerp(yf0001, yf1001, zs);
1759        final float zf101 = lerp(yf0101, yf1101, zs);
1760
1761        final float zf011 = lerp(yf0011, yf1011, zs);
1762        final float zf111 = lerp(yf0111, yf1111, zs);
1763
1764        final float wf00 = lerp(zf000, zf100, ws);
1765        final float wf10 = lerp(zf010, zf110, ws);
1766        final float wf01 = lerp(zf001, zf101, ws);
1767        final float wf11 = lerp(zf011, zf111, ws);
1768
1769        final float uf0 = lerp(wf00, wf10, us);
1770        final float uf1 = lerp(wf01, wf11, us);
1771
1772        return lerp(uf0, uf1, vs);
1773    }
1774    private float singleValueFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1775        int seed = this.seed;
1776        float sum = singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v);
1777        float amp = 1;
1778
1779        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1780            x *= lacunarity;
1781            y *= lacunarity;
1782            z *= lacunarity;
1783            w *= lacunarity;
1784            u *= lacunarity;
1785            v *= lacunarity;
1786
1787            amp *= gain;
1788            sum += singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u, v) * amp;
1789        }
1790
1791        return sum * fractalBounding;
1792    }
1793
1794    private float singleValueFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1795        int seed = this.seed;
1796        float sum = Math.abs(singleValue(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v)) * 2 - 1;
1797        float amp = 1;
1798
1799        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1800            x *= lacunarity;
1801            y *= lacunarity;
1802            z *= lacunarity;
1803            w *= lacunarity;
1804            u *= lacunarity;
1805            v *= lacunarity;
1806
1807            amp *= gain;
1808            sum += (Math.abs(singleValue(++seed, x, y, z, w, u, v)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1809        }
1810
1811        return sum * fractalBounding;
1812    }
1813
1814    private float singleValueFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
1815        int seed = this.seed;
1816        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1817        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1818            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singleValue(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u, v));
1819            spike *= spike * amp;
1820            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1821            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1822            ampBias *= 2f;
1823            x *= lacunarity;
1824            y *= lacunarity;
1825            z *= lacunarity;
1826            w *= lacunarity;
1827            u *= lacunarity;
1828            v *= lacunarity;
1829        }
1830        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1831    }
1832
1833
1834
1835    // Gradient Noise
1836    public float getPerlinFractal(float x, float y, float z) {
1837        x *= frequency;
1838        y *= frequency;
1839        z *= frequency;
1840
1841        switch (fractalType) {
1842            case FBM:
1843                return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y, z);
1844            case BILLOW:
1845                return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y, z);
1846            case RIDGED_MULTI:
1847                return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
1848            default:
1849                return 0;
1850        }
1851    }
1852
1853    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z) {
1854        int seed = this.seed;
1855        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z);
1856        float amp = 1;
1857
1858        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1859            x *= lacunarity;
1860            y *= lacunarity;
1861            z *= lacunarity;
1862
1863            amp *= gain;
1864            sum += singlePerlin(++seed, x, y, z) * amp;
1865        }
1866
1867        return sum * fractalBounding;
1868    }
1869
1870    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z) {
1871        int seed = this.seed;
1872        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1;
1873        float amp = 1;
1874
1875        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
1876            x *= lacunarity;
1877            y *= lacunarity;
1878            z *= lacunarity;
1879
1880            amp *= gain;
1881            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(++seed, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
1882        }
1883
1884        return sum * fractalBounding;
1885    }
1886
1887    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z) {
1888        int seed = this.seed;
1889        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
1890        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1891            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z));
1892            spike *= spike * amp;
1893            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
1894            sum += (spike * ampBias);
1895            ampBias *= 2f;
1896            x *= lacunarity;
1897            y *= lacunarity;
1898            z *= lacunarity;
1899        }
1900        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
1901    }
1902
1903    public float getPerlin(float x, float y, float z) {
1904        return singlePerlin(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency);
1905    }
1906
1907    private float singlePerlin(int seed, float x, float y, float z) {
1908        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
1909        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
1910        int z0 = fastFloor(z);
1911        int x1 = x0 + 1;
1912        int y1 = y0 + 1;
1913        int z1 = z0 + 1;
1914
1915        float xs, ys, zs;
1916        switch (interpolation) {
1917            default:
1918            case LINEAR:
1919                xs = x - x0;
1920                ys = y - y0;
1921                zs = z - z0;
1922                break;
1923            case HERMITE:
1924                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
1925                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
1926                zs = hermiteInterpolator(z - z0);
1927                break;
1928            case QUINTIC:
1929                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
1930                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
1931                zs = quinticInterpolator(z - z0);
1932                break;
1933        }
1934
1935        final float xd0 = x - x0;
1936        final float yd0 = y - y0;
1937        final float zd0 = z - z0;
1938        final float xd1 = xd0 - 1;
1939        final float yd1 = yd0 - 1;
1940        final float zd1 = zd0 - 1;
1941
1942        final float xf00 = lerp(gradCoord3D(seed, x0, y0, z0, xd0, yd0, zd0), gradCoord3D(seed, x1, y0, z0, xd1, yd0, zd0), xs);
1943        final float xf10 = lerp(gradCoord3D(seed, x0, y1, z0, xd0, yd1, zd0), gradCoord3D(seed, x1, y1, z0, xd1, yd1, zd0), xs);
1944        final float xf01 = lerp(gradCoord3D(seed, x0, y0, z1, xd0, yd0, zd1), gradCoord3D(seed, x1, y0, z1, xd1, yd0, zd1), xs);
1945        final float xf11 = lerp(gradCoord3D(seed, x0, y1, z1, xd0, yd1, zd1), gradCoord3D(seed, x1, y1, z1, xd1, yd1, zd1), xs);
1946
1947        final float yf0 = lerp(xf00, xf10, ys);
1948        final float yf1 = lerp(xf01, xf11, ys);
1949
1950        return lerp(yf0, yf1, zs);
1951    }
1952    public float getPerlin(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1953        return singlePerlin(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency);
1954    }
1955
1956    private float singlePerlin(int seed, float x, float y, float z, float w) {
1957        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
1958        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
1959        int z0 = fastFloor(z);
1960        int w0 = fastFloor(w);
1961        int x1 = x0 + 1;
1962        int y1 = y0 + 1;
1963        int z1 = z0 + 1;
1964        int w1 = w0 + 1;
1965
1966        float xs, ys, zs, ws;
1967        switch (interpolation) {
1968            default:
1969            case LINEAR:
1970                xs = x - x0;
1971                ys = y - y0;
1972                zs = z - z0;
1973                ws = w - w0;
1974                break;
1975            case HERMITE:
1976                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
1977                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
1978                zs = hermiteInterpolator(z - z0);
1979                ws = hermiteInterpolator(w - w0);
1980                break;
1981            case QUINTIC:
1982                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
1983                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
1984                zs = quinticInterpolator(z - z0);
1985                ws = quinticInterpolator(w - w0);
1986                break;
1987        }
1988
1989        final float xd0 = x - x0;
1990        final float yd0 = y - y0;
1991        final float zd0 = z - z0;
1992        final float wd0 = w - w0;
1993        final float xd1 = xd0 - 1;
1994        final float yd1 = yd0 - 1;
1995        final float zd1 = zd0 - 1;
1996        final float wd1 = wd0 - 1;
1997
1998        final float xf000 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w0, xd0, yd0, zd0, wd0), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w0, xd1, yd0, zd0, wd0), xs);
1999        final float xf100 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w0, xd0, yd1, zd0, wd0), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w0, xd1, yd1, zd0, wd0), xs);
2000        final float xf010 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w0, xd0, yd0, zd1, wd0), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w0, xd1, yd0, zd1, wd0), xs);
2001        final float xf110 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w0, xd0, yd1, zd1, wd0), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w0, xd1, yd1, zd1, wd0), xs);
2002        final float xf001 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z0, w1, xd0, yd0, zd0, wd1), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z0, w1, xd1, yd0, zd0, wd1), xs);
2003        final float xf101 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z0, w1, xd0, yd1, zd0, wd1), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z0, w1, xd1, yd1, zd0, wd1), xs);
2004        final float xf011 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y0, z1, w1, xd0, yd0, zd1, wd1), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y0, z1, w1, xd1, yd0, zd1, wd1), xs);
2005        final float xf111 = lerp(gradCoord4D(seed, x0, y1, z1, w1, xd0, yd1, zd1, wd1), gradCoord4D(seed, x1, y1, z1, w1, xd1, yd1, zd1, wd1), xs);
2006
2007        final float yf00 = lerp(xf000, xf100, ys);
2008        final float yf10 = lerp(xf010, xf110, ys);
2009        final float yf01 = lerp(xf001, xf101, ys);
2010        final float yf11 = lerp(xf011, xf111, ys);
2011
2012        final float zf0 = lerp(yf00, yf10, zs);
2013        final float zf1 = lerp(yf01, yf11, zs);
2014        return lerp(zf0, zf1, ws);
2015    }
2016    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
2017        int seed = this.seed;
2018        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w);
2019        float amp = 1;
2020
2021        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2022            x *= lacunarity;
2023            y *= lacunarity;
2024            z *= lacunarity;
2025            w *= lacunarity;
2026
2027            amp *= gain;
2028            sum += singlePerlin(++seed, x, y, z, w) * amp;
2029        }
2030
2031        return sum * fractalBounding;
2032    }
2033
2034    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
2035        int seed = this.seed;
2036        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w)) * 2 - 1;
2037        float amp = 1;
2038
2039        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2040            x *= lacunarity;
2041            y *= lacunarity;
2042            z *= lacunarity;
2043            w *= lacunarity;
2044
2045            amp *= gain;
2046            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(++seed, x, y, z, w)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2047        }
2048
2049        return sum * fractalBounding;
2050    }
2051
2052    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w) {
2053        int seed = this.seed;
2054        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
2055        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2056            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y,  z, w));
2057            spike *= spike * amp;
2058            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
2059            sum += (spike * ampBias);
2060            ampBias *= 2f;
2061            x *= lacunarity;
2062            y *= lacunarity;
2063            z *= lacunarity;
2064            w *= lacunarity;
2065        }
2066        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
2067    }
2068
2069    public float getPerlinFractal(float x, float y) {
2070        x *= frequency;
2071        y *= frequency;
2072
2073        switch (fractalType) {
2074            case FBM:
2075                return singlePerlinFractalFBM(x, y);
2076            case BILLOW:
2077                return singlePerlinFractalBillow(x, y);
2078            case RIDGED_MULTI:
2079                return singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(x, y);
2080            default:
2081                return 0;
2082        }
2083    }
2084
2085    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y) {
2086        int seed = this.seed;
2087        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y);
2088        float amp = 1;
2089
2090        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2091            x *= lacunarity;
2092            y *= lacunarity;
2093
2094            amp *= gain;
2095            sum += singlePerlin(++seed, x, y) * amp;
2096        }
2097
2098        return sum * fractalBounding;
2099    }
2100
2101    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y) {
2102        int seed = this.seed;
2103        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1;
2104        float amp = 1;
2105
2106        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2107            x *= lacunarity;
2108            y *= lacunarity;
2109
2110            amp *= gain;
2111            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(++seed, x, y)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2112        }
2113
2114        return sum * fractalBounding;
2115    }
2116
2117    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y) {
2118        int seed = this.seed;
2119        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
2120        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2121            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y));
2122            spike *= spike * amp;
2123            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
2124            sum += (spike * ampBias);
2125            ampBias *= 2f;
2126            x *= lacunarity;
2127            y *= lacunarity;
2128        }
2129        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
2130    }
2131
2132    public float getPerlin(float x, float y) {
2133        return singlePerlin(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency);
2134    }
2135
2136    private float singlePerlin(int seed, float x, float y) {
2137        int x0 = fastFloor(x);
2138        int y0 = fastFloor(y);
2139        int x1 = x0 + 1;
2140        int y1 = y0 + 1;
2141
2142        float xs, ys;
2143        switch (interpolation) {
2144            default:
2145            case LINEAR:
2146                xs = x - x0;
2147                ys = y - y0;
2148                break;
2149            case HERMITE:
2150                xs = hermiteInterpolator(x - x0);
2151                ys = hermiteInterpolator(y - y0);
2152                break;
2153            case QUINTIC:
2154                xs = quinticInterpolator(x - x0);
2155                ys = quinticInterpolator(y - y0);
2156                break;
2157        }
2158
2159        float xd0 = x - x0;
2160        float yd0 = y - y0;
2161        float xd1 = xd0 - 1;
2162        float yd1 = yd0 - 1;
2163
2164        float xf0 = lerp(gradCoord2D(seed, x0, y0, xd0, yd0), gradCoord2D(seed, x1, y0, xd1, yd0), xs);
2165        float xf1 = lerp(gradCoord2D(seed, x0, y1, xd0, yd1), gradCoord2D(seed, x1, y1, xd1, yd1), xs);
2166
2167        return lerp(xf0, xf1, ys);
2168    }
2169    public float getPerlin(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2170        return singlePerlin(seed, x * frequency, y * frequency, z * frequency, w * frequency, u * frequency, v * frequency);
2171    }

2185        int v1 = v0 + 1;

2191                xs = x - x0;

2196                vs = v - v0;

2277        final float yf0101 = lerp(xf00101, xf10101, ys);
2278        final float yf1101 = lerp(xf01101, xf11101, ys);
2279
2280        final float yf0011 = lerp(xf00011, xf10011, ys);
2281        final float yf1011 = lerp(xf01011, xf11011, ys);
2282        final float yf0111 = lerp(xf00111, xf10111, ys);
2283        final float yf1111 = lerp(xf01111, xf11111, ys);
2284
2285        final float zf000 = lerp(yf0000, yf1000, zs);
2286        final float zf100 = lerp(yf0100, yf1100, zs);
2287
2288        final float zf010 = lerp(yf0010, yf1010, zs);
2289        final float zf110 = lerp(yf0110, yf1110, zs);
2290
2291        final float zf001 = lerp(yf0001, yf1001, zs);
2292        final float zf101 = lerp(yf0101, yf1101, zs);
2293
2294        final float zf011 = lerp(yf0011, yf1011, zs);
2295        final float zf111 = lerp(yf0111, yf1111, zs);
2296
2297        final float wf00 = lerp(zf000, zf100, ws);
2298        final float wf10 = lerp(zf010, zf110, ws);
2299        final float wf01 = lerp(zf001, zf101, ws);
2300        final float wf11 = lerp(zf011, zf111, ws);
2301
2302        final float uf0 = lerp(wf00, wf10, us);
2303        final float uf1 = lerp(wf01, wf11, us);
2304
2305        return lerp(uf0, uf1, vs);
2306    }
2307    private float singlePerlinFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2308        int seed = this.seed;
2309        float sum = singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v);
2310        float amp = 1;
2311
2312        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2313            x *= lacunarity;
2314            y *= lacunarity;
2315            z *= lacunarity;
2316            w *= lacunarity;
2317            u *= lacunarity;
2318            v *= lacunarity;
2319
2320            amp *= gain;
2321            sum += singlePerlin(++seed, x, y, z, w, u, v) * amp;
2322        }
2323
2324        return sum * fractalBounding;
2325    }
2326
2327    private float singlePerlinFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2328        int seed = this.seed;
2329        float sum = Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed, x, y, z, w, u, v)) * 2 - 1;
2330        float amp = 1;
2331
2332        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2333            x *= lacunarity;
2334            y *= lacunarity;
2335            z *= lacunarity;
2336            w *= lacunarity;
2337            u *= lacunarity;
2338            v *= lacunarity;
2339
2340            amp *= gain;
2341            sum += (Math.abs(singlePerlin(++seed, x, y, z, w, u, v)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2342        }
2343
2344        return sum * fractalBounding;
2345    }
2346
2347    private float singlePerlinFractalRidgedMulti(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v) {
2348        int seed = this.seed;
2349        float sum = 0, amp = 1, ampBias = 1f, spike;
2350        for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
2351            spike = 1f - Math.abs(singlePerlin(seed + i, x, y, z, w, u, v));
2352            spike *= spike * amp;
2353            amp = Math.max(0f, Math.min(1f, spike * 2f));
2354            sum += (spike * ampBias);
2355            ampBias *= 2f;
2356            x *= lacunarity;
2357            y *= lacunarity;
2358            z *= lacunarity;
2359            w *= lacunarity;
2360            u *= lacunarity;
2361            v *= lacunarity;
2362        }
2363        return sum / ((ampBias - 1f) * 0.5f) - 1f;
2364    }
2365
2366    // Simplex Noise
2367    public float getSimplexFractal(float x, float y, float z) {
2368        x *= frequency;
2369        y *= frequency;
2370        z *= frequency;
2371
2372        switch (fractalType) {
2373            case FBM:
2374                return singleSimplexFractalFBM(x, y, z);
2375            case BILLOW:
2376                return singleSimplexFractalBillow(x, y, z);
2377            case RIDGED_MULTI:
2378                return singleSimplexFractalRidgedMulti(x, y, z);
2379            default:
2380                return 0;
2381        }
2382    }
2383
2384    /**
2385     * Generates ridged-multi simplex noise with the given amount of octaves and default frequency (0.03125), lacunarity
2386     * (2) and gain (0.5) in 3D.
2387     * @param x
2388     * @param y
2389     * @param z
2390     * @param seed
2391     * @param octaves
2392     * @return noise as a float between -1f and 1f
2393     */
2394    public float layered3D(float x, float y, float z, int seed, int octaves)
2395    {
2396        x *= 0.03125f;
2397        y *= 0.03125f;
2398        z *= 0.03125f;
2399
2400        float sum = 1 - Math.abs(singleSimplex(seed, x, y, z));
2401        float amp = 1;
2402
2403        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2404            x *= 2f;
2405            y *= 2f;
2406            z *= 2f;
2407
2408            amp *= 0.5f;
2409            sum -= (1 - Math.abs(singleSimplex(seed + i, x, y, z))) * amp;
2410        }
2411        amp = gain;
2412        float ampFractal = 1;
2413        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2414            ampFractal += amp;
2415            amp *= gain;
2416        }
2417        return sum / ampFractal;
2418    }
2419    /**
2420     * Generates ridged-multi simplex noise with the given amount of octaves and default frequency (0.03125), lacunarity
2421     * (2) and gain (0.5) in 3D.
2422     * @param x
2423     * @param y
2424     * @param z
2425     * @param seed
2426     * @param octaves
2427     * @return noise as a float between -1f and 1f
2428     */
2429    public float layered3D(float x, float y, float z, int seed, int octaves, float frequency)
2430    {
2431        x *= frequency;
2432        y *= frequency;
2433        z *= frequency;
2434
2435        float sum = singleSimplex(seed, x, y, z);
2436        float amp = 1;
2437
2438        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2439            x *= 2f;
2440            y *= 2f;
2441            z *= 2f;
2442
2443            amp *= 0.5f;
2444            sum += singleSimplex(seed + i, x, y, z) * amp;
2445        }
2446        amp = gain;
2447        float ampFractal = 1;
2448        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2449            ampFractal += amp;
2450            amp *= gain;
2451        }
2452        return sum / ampFractal;
2453    }
2454    /**
2455     * Generates layered simplex noise with the given amount of octaves and specified lacunarity (the amount of
2456     * frequency change between octaves) and gain (0.5) in 3D.
2457     * @param x
2458     * @param y
2459     * @param z
2460     * @param seed
2461     * @param octaves
2462     * @param frequency
2463     * @param lacunarity

2469        y *= frequency;
2470        z *= frequency;

2473        float amp = 1;
2474

2476            x *= lacunarity;
2477            y *= lacunarity;
2478            z *= lacunarity;
2479
2480            amp *= 0.5f;
2481            sum += singleSimplex(seed + i, x, y, z) * amp;
2482        }

2484        float ampFractal = 1;
2485        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {

2487            amp *= gain;
2488        }

2490    }

2500     * @param frequency

2513
2514        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2515            x *= lacunarity;
2516            y *= lacunarity;
2517            z *= lacunarity;
2518
2519            amp *= gain;
2520            sum += singleSimplex(seed + i, x, y, z) * amp;
2521        }

2531    private float singleSimplexFractalFBM(float x, float y, float z) {
2532        int seed = this.seed;
2533        float sum = singleSimplex(seed, x, y, z);
2534        float amp = 1;
2535
2536        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2537            x *= lacunarity;
2538            y *= lacunarity;
2539            z *= lacunarity;
2540
2541            amp *= gain;
2542            sum += singleSimplex(seed + i, x, y, z) * amp;
2543        }
2544
2545        return sum * fractalBounding;
2546    }
2547
2548    private float singleSimplexFractalBillow(float x, float y, float z) {
2549        int seed = this.seed;
2550        float sum = Math.abs(singleSimplex(seed, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1;
2551        float amp = 1;
2552
2553        for (int i = 1; i < octaves; i++) {
2554            x *= lacunarity;
2555            y *= lacunarity;
2556            z *= lacunarity;
2557
2558            amp *= gain;
2559            sum += (Math.abs(singleSimplex(seed + i, x, y, z)) * 2 - 1) * amp;
2560        }
2561
2562        return sum * fractalBounding;
2563    }
